=== Purchase Information ===

Average Rating: 4.3
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Michael Mann'], 'Producers': ['Thomas Tull', 'Michael Mann', 'Jon Jashni'], 'Starring': ['Chris Hemsworth', 'Tang Wei', 'Viola Davis'], 'Studio': ['Universal Pictures']}
Review Text: If you have a couple of hours to kill and don't want to think, it's not required for this movie.  Warning the rest of this review has spoilers ... I have seen Chris Hemsworth in quite a few movies and he has always had a solid performance.  This one, not believable at all, so I have to blame directing, which is shocking because it's Michael Mann.  The "love" interest happens so quickly that it's not believable at all ( they look at each other and end up in bed, even drunk one night stands have a little more foreplay) and really not even necessary for this film.  Had they fallen "in love" after the brothers death, it would have played out better.  Having TV actors, low budget film actors in prime roles along side Hemsworth was confusing to say the least and just had me scratching my head.  They would have been better using actors we had never seen before.  The transition of this movie is so "choppy", no smooth transitions into next scenes, I was wondering if they ended up on the editors floor or the movie was just written that way.  It was all so predictable, sadly I knew the brothers car was going to blow up and I had never seen the movie before.  More of a made for TV Sunday Afternoon viewing than a major film.  I wouldn't pay to rent it, wait for it go up for free, which should be real soon.
Review Title: Don't rent, wait for it to be free, then you won't feel robbed.
Rating: 3.0

Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Michael Mann'], 'Producers': ['Thomas Tull', 'Michael Mann', 'Jon Jashni'], 'Starring': ['Chris Hemsworth', 'Tang Wei', 'Viola Davis'], 'Studio': ['Universal Pictures']}
Review Text: If you have a couple of hours to kill and don't want to think, it's not required for this movie.  Warning the rest of this review has spoilers ... I have seen Chris Hemsworth in quite a few movies and he has always had a solid performance.  This one, not believable at all, so I have to blame directing, which is shocking because it's Michael Mann.  The "love" interest happens so quickly that it's not believable at all ( they look at each other and end up in bed, even drunk one night stands have a little more foreplay) and really not even necessary for this film.  Had they fallen "in love" after the brothers death, it would have played out better.  Having TV actors, low budget film actors in prime roles along side Hemsworth was confusing to say the least and just had me scratching my head.  They would have been better using actors we had never seen before.  The transition of this movie is so "choppy", no smooth transitions into next scenes, I was wondering if they ended up on the editors floor or the movie was just written that way.  It was all so predictable, sadly I knew the brothers car was going to blow up and I had never seen the movie before.  More of a made for TV Sunday Afternoon viewing than a major film.  I wouldn't pay to rent it, wait for it go up for free, which should be real soon.
Review Title: Don't rent, wait for it to be free, then you won't feel robbed.
Rating: 3.0
--------------------------------------------------

raw_response:
POSITIVE SUMMARY:  
The user has expressed high satisfaction with several movies and shows, highlighting their enjoyment of strong characters and engaging narratives. They particularly loved captivating twists, humor, and action-packed sequences, showing a preference for content that keeps them on the edge of their seat. The user appreciates productions featuring confident female leads, finding them relatable and empowering. Several reviews reflect their addiction to certain series, underlining a consistent enjoyment of high-quality entertainment that is both engaging and memorable.

NEGATIVE SUMMARY:  
Despite the user's enjoyment of many films, they have also experienced significant disappointment. They expressed dissatisfaction with movies that they found dull or unrealistic, calling some the "dumbest" and wishing they could reclaim their time. Specifically, they criticized weak storylines, lack of believable character interactions, and poor pacing, describing some films as unworthy of rental fees. The harsh reviews indicate frustration with productions that failed to meet their expectations, contributing to an overall critical perspective on certain content.

OVERALL SUMMARY:  
The user's viewing experiences reflect a blend of passionate enjoyment and notable frustrations. They frequently praise shows and films that deliver thrilling narratives and strong performances, particularly those with empowered female characters. However, their negative reviews reveal a critical lens for movies that fail to engage or entertain sufficiently. This duality suggests a discerning viewer who seeks both quality storytelling and relatable characters, resulting in a diverse range of responses across their viewing history.

target_interaction.title: Worth watching for sure!
target_interaction.text: It was really good, not what I was expecting.
description: Time travelers arrive from 2051 to deliver an urgent message: 30 years in the future mankind is losing a war against a deadly alien species. The only hope for survival is for soldiers and civilians to be transported to the future and join the fight. Determined to save the world for his daughter, Dan Forester teams up with a brilliant scientist and his estranged father to rewrite the planet’s fate.
